fr.sii.ogham.email.message.fluent

Class BodyBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.email.message.fluent.BodyBuilder

  • public class BodyBuilder
extends Object
    Fluent API to build a content based on:
    • Either a single string
    • Or a single template string
    • Or a single template loaded from a path
    • Or two templates (HTML and text) loaded from a path
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • string

        public Email string(String content)
        Set the content directly as a simple string.

        The body will have only one part (only one main body and no alternative body). It can be either HTML or textual.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If any other method of this class was called before calling this method, only the value of this method is used.

        Parameters:
        content - the content as a string
        Returns:
        the instance for fluent chaining

      • templateString

        public Email templateString(String template,
                            Object bean)
        Set the content using a template (directly provided as a string). The template contains variables that are evaluated against the bean object.

        The body will have only one part (only one main body and no alternative body). It can be either HTML or textual.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If any other method of this class was called before calling this method, only the value of this method is used.

        Parameters:
        template - the template directly provided as a string
        bean - the object that contains the variables that are referenced in the template
        Returns:
        the instance for fluent chaining

      • templateString

        public Email templateString(String template,
                            Context context)
        Set the content using a template (directly provided as a string). The template contains variables that are evaluated against the evaluation context. The context contains at least the values of the variables but can also contain additional information for parsing the template.

        The body will have only one part (only one main body and no alternative body). It can be either HTML or textual.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If any other method of this class was called before calling this method, only the value of this method is used.

        Parameters:
        template - the template directly provided as a string
        context - contains at least the variables that are referenced in the template and may contain additional information to parse the template
        Returns:
        the instance for fluent chaining

      • template

        public Email template(String templatePath,
                      Object bean)
        Set the content using template(s) loaded from a path. The template(s) contain variables that are evaluated against the bean object.

        This method lets you provide both main body and alternative body using a single path (without extension). For example: You have two templates:

        • A textual template located at /templates/email/register.txt in the classpath
        • An HTML template located at /templates/email/register.html in the classpath
        You can reference both templates with the same model: 
          .template("/templates/email/register", new RegistrationContext(...))
        Both templates will be parsed using the same evaluation context. The HTML template will be used as the main body and the textual template will be used as the alternative body (when the email client can't read the HTML body).

        NOTE: the extensions varies according to template engine that is used to parse the template.

        This method is really convenient as if one template is missing (for example, you have only written the HTML template but not the textual template already), the found template is used as the main body (and the email won't have the alternative part). This way you can later add the missing template without changing your code.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If any other method of this class was called before calling this method, only the value of this method is used.

        Parameters:
        templatePath - the path to the template
        bean - the object that contains the variables that are referenced in the template
        Returns:
        the instance for fluent chaining

      • template

      • template

        public Email template(String templatePath,
                      Context context)
        Set the content using template(s) loaded from a path. The template(s) contain variables that are evaluated against the evaluation context. The context contains at least the values of the variables but can also contain additional information for parsing the template.

      • build

        public Content build()
        Build the final Content. template(ResourcePath, Context) method (and variants) preempts any call to string(String), templateString(String, Context) and templateString(String, Object).
        Returns:
        the built content
